title: How much time will it take to read the complete Mahabharata? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on WHY you want to read itJust for synopsis - Amarakatha like book - 3–4 days (for full stories)Book for children - may be 1 weekAll available general book - say a yearVersions of Mahabharat (with folklore) - try for another yearso onAfter reading translated work and reading BORI’s researched workwill take another - year or two (to digest the truth) For analytical study - it is a lifelong read. I have not touched the spiritual or philosophical aspect! But, YES, Start to read with C Rajahopalachari’s Book, good to start with covers most of the main storyThen preferably KMGThen BORI’s translated work -by Bibek Debroy. Yes, forgot to mention - READ IT do not SEE it. This is my personal view

How much time does it take to LIVE? Same same required. None can read complete Mbh text in a lifetime, unless one learns to Live simultaneously. Unless one learns to Live fully, one would read Mbh selectively and feel repulsion to some other parts. Mbh is thus a test whether you have power of acceptance to all different colours of life.
